name: admin.workflows.search
desc: Search workflows within the team or enterprise

app_id.desc: The parent app ID for which to return workflows.

collaborator_ids.desc: Only include workflows where all of the provided user IDs are a manager/collaborator of that workflow.

cursor.desc: Set `cursor` to `next_cursor` returned by the previous call to list items in the next page.

is_sales_elevate.desc: Filter workflows by their Sales Elevate status.

limit.desc: The number of results that will be returned by the API on each invocation.

no_collaborators.desc: Only include workflows with no collaborators in the result; default is false.

num_trigger_ids.desc: Number of trigger IDs to fetch for each workflow; default is 10.

publish_status.desc: Filter workflows by their published status.

query.desc: A search query to filter for workflow name or description.

sort.desc: The field used to sort the returned workflows.

sort_dir.desc: Sort direction. Possible values are `asc` for ascending order like (1, 2, 3) or (a, b, c), and `desc` for descending order like (3, 2, 1) or (c, b, a).

source.desc: Source of workflow creation, either from code or workflow builder.

step_function_ids.desc: Only include workflows that use all of the provided step function ids.

trigger_type_id.desc: Only include workflows with this trigger type.

errors.invalid_cursor: Value passed for `cursor` was not valid or is no longer valid.
errors.not_allowed: The user is not allowed to access this API method.
